name: site-maintenance-mode
description: Put an IIS website under maintenance or online again.
author: Jungerius IT
helpMarkDown: If you put an app_offline.htm file in the root of your web application, IIS will shut down the application and only serve this webpage as an result. After you rename/delete the file the site will be back online.

inputs.name: computerName
inputs.label: Computer name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Leave empty if you want to perform this operation on the local computer. When you want to use Remote Powershell you can fill in the desired remote computer.

inputs.name: state
inputs.label: Change to
inputs.helpMarkDown: State to put the website in

inputs.name: webRoot
inputs.label: Site root directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The directory where the website is running.

inputs.name: offlineFileName
inputs.label: Offline filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: The filename to use to take the site offline.

inputs.name: onlineFileName
inputs.label: Online filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: The filename to use to take the site online.

inputs.name: throwFailure
inputs.label: Fail deployment on error
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the whole deployment if this operation cannot succeed

inputs.name: delayBefore
inputs.label: Seconds delay before
inputs.helpMarkDown: Amount of seconds to wait before changing the state of the website

inputs.name: delayAfter
inputs.label: Seconds delay after
inputs.helpMarkDown: Amount of seconds to wait after changing the state of the website
